body_html:
@MatthiasWinkelmann I have a bit of an ignorant question... What does the constexpr section achieve in your guide? I don't remember making those changes when compiling with GPU support on macOS in the past...

Also is installing gcc, etc truly necessary? I just checked and although I have installed gcc through Homebrew, it has also been installed through Xcode (and in .tf_configure_bazelrc GCC_HOST_COMPILER_PATH="/usr/bin/gcc") and my somewhat recent builds are working fine (although I am using Xcode 8.2.1).
body_text:
@MatthiasWinkelmann I have a bit of an ignorant question... What does the constexpr section achieve in your guide? I don't remember making those changes when compiling with GPU support on macOS in the past...
Also is installing gcc, etc truly necessary? I just checked and although I have installed gcc through Homebrew, it has also been installed through Xcode (and in .tf_configure_bazelrc GCC_HOST_COMPILER_PATH="/usr/bin/gcc") and my somewhat recent builds are working fine (although I am using Xcode 8.2.1).
body:
@MatthiasWinkelmann I have a bit of an ignorant question... What does the `constexpr` section achieve in your guide? I don't remember making those changes when compiling with GPU support on macOS in the past... 

Also is installing `gcc`, etc truly necessary? I just checked and although I have installed gcc through Homebrew, it has also been installed through Xcode (and in `.tf_configure_bazelrc` `GCC_HOST_COMPILER_PATH="/usr/bin/gcc"`) and my somewhat recent builds are working fine (although I am using Xcode 8.2.1).
